image.altText: Two girls sit on a couch and smile for a photo

props.synopsis: With Tasmanians heading to the polls on Saturday, young voters share some of the issues important to them, while saying that major parties simply aren't getting through to many of them.

title.children: The issues influencing the votes of young Tasmanians this election

image.altText: A young man with curly blonde hair wears an apron and holds his arms up to display his biceps.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest has begun into the death of north-west Tasmanian footballer Brady James Hubbard. The court has heard of "inconsistencies" in witness accounts of how Mr Hubbard received his fatal injuries, and his uncle told the court the club "covered it up".

title.children: 'They covered it up': Court told of uncle's concerns over nephew's death

image.altText: Gerard Dezoete wears a suit and tie and dark sunglasses and looks at the camera with a serious expression

props.synopsis: Experienced tradesman Gerard Dezoete died after falling from a scissor lift on a construction site in central Launceston in 2020. The company contracting him has been cleared of all but one safety breach.

title.children: Man killed in fall from scissor lift had 'mental lapse': Magistrate

image.altText: A mother sheep and two lambs in an open paddock

props.synopsis: The English Leicester makes no money on the farm's profit and loss sheet, but some farmers are passionate about the breed and its long, lustrous fleece.

title.children: Tasmanian farmers keep a rare sheep breed that makes no sense or cents

image.altText: Wind turbines black and white.

props.synopsis: International energy companies are reconsidering their investments in Australian offshore wind projects as the Trump administration's disruption of the industry causes global uncertainty.

title.children: Energy giant drops offshore wind project amid global 'headwinds'

image.altText: hand puts a ballot into a voting ballot box

props.synopsis: Where can I vote? Can I take a selfie while doing it? Who are the candidates? All your questions about the Tasmanian state election answered.

title.children: Your questions about Tasmania's election answered

image.altText: Photos of a prepolling centre for a state election.

props.synopsis: Tasmania leads the country in casting informal votes — here's how to make sure your ballot paper counts on July 19.

title.children: How to make your vote count at the Tasmanian election

image.altText: Thumbnail image for Tasmania state election 2025 promise tracker article.

props.synopsis: As Tasmanians prepare for a July 19 vote, we keep track of each party's election promises on everything from health and housing, to the stadium.

title.children: What are Tasmanians being promised at their state election?

image.altText: Family stands outside court

props.synopsis: Judge Michael Wigney rules the federal government owes no duty of care to Torres Strait Islanders over climate change, but also finds Australia's emissions reductions targets up to 2021 are not based "on the best available science".

title.children: 'My heart is broken': Torres Strait Islanders lose landmark climate case

image.altText: Adam Scott and Britt Lower side-by-side in a scene in Severance.

props.synopsis: Other shows nominated include The White Lotus and The Bear. See the full list of nominees.

title.children: Severance receives 27 Emmy nods as nominations list revealed

image.altText: Camp site with police tape surrounding

props.synopsis: A 42-year-old man known to the child has been charged with manslaughter over the death of a seven-month-old baby boy who was pulled from a lake by his mother at a park outside Gympie over the weekend.

title.children: Man charged with manslaughter over death of baby pulled from lake

image.altText: A sign board reading 'Matcha is out of stock', with Japanese characters underneath.

props.synopsis: From traditional tea ceremonies to viral TikToks, the rising popularity of matcha is driving a global shortage, leaving farmers, suppliers and cafes trying to keep up.

title.children: Matcha's 'unprecedented' hype leads to global shortage

image.altText: Two soldiers on the ground in camoflauge firing a Carl Gustaf weapon.

props.synopsis: This weapon that has been fired by decades of Australian soldiers may have been causing damage to their brains from blast waves.

title.children: This weapon can blow up a tank. Soldiers firing it are suffering brain injuries

image.altText: Mark Latham sat down wearing a suit and tie

props.synopsis: New South Wales MP Mark Latham denies the allegations of abuse, made by his former partner, as "comically false and ridiculous".

title.children: Mark Latham denies ex-partner's allegations of domestic abuse and 'degrading' sex acts

image.altText: A man in a blue suit, white shirt and red tie speaks to someone out of frame while standing behind a microphone

props.synopsis: The US president announces the agreement on his social media platform but provides no further details on the deal.

title.children: Trump says trade deal with Indonesia 'great deal, for everybody'

image.altText: A close up of a man's hands placed together in front of his body in a worried pose.

props.synopsis: Experts say Australia is reaching a "tipping point" as mental health insurance claims surge, raising criticisms that super funds and insurers may be dragging out payouts for people with a mental illness.

title.children: Mental health insurance claims nearly double in five years

image.altText: Woman sits in a chair in a psychologist's office as they show her something on a clipboard.

props.synopsis: A number of states have indicated they will soon allow GPs to diagnose ADHD, but doctors warn patients may still face out-of-pocket costs or have difficulty accessing prescriptions.

title.children: GPs set to diagnose ADHD, but say appointments unlikely to be bulk-billed

image.altText: a flooded subway station in New York, water shooting up from the ground

props.synopsis: Two people are killed as their vehicle is swept up in floodwaters in New Jersey while in New York, the rains flood the subway system.

title.children: Two dead after heavy storm leaves New York subway system flooded

image.altText: Masked men holding machine guns in the back of a military ute.

props.synopsis: Deadly sectarian clashes in Syria have left dozens dead and threatened the survival of the country's fragile post-war order.

title.children: After the downfall of a regime, here's why Israel is striking Syria

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt and tie speaking into five microphones while another man stands behind him.

props.synopsis: The latest budget figures reveal the state is set to reap $1.78 billion from insurance duty in 2025-26, and $2b by 2028-29.

title.children: Queensland on track to get $2b from tax labelled as 'robbing people' by premier

image.altText: The back of a policeman facing the felled tree with tape that says police line do not cross

props.synopsis: The two men were jailed for for four years and three months for felling the Sycamore — estimated to be almost 200 years old.

title.children: Duo behind 'senseless' felling of UK's historic Sycamore Gap tree jailed

image.altText: A close up shot of Angus Taylor standing in front of an Australian flag.

props.synopsis: Shadow Defence Minister Angus Taylor is calling on the government to "make principled commitments to the security of Taiwan" amid pressure from the United States.

title.children: Government should be 'prepared to act' on Taiwan, Angus Taylor says

image.altText: Photo illustration exterior view of Terraces by Carter Williamson for NSW pattern book

props.synopsis: These housing designs are focused on densifying the suburbs and fast-tracking low-rise housing throughout Sydney and beyond.

title.children: For just $1 a design, expect to see these homes pop up across Sydney

image.altText: Paul Gallen and Sonny Bill Williams composite

props.synopsis: Paul Gallen and Sonny Bill Williams will meet in the boxing ring on Wednesday night in a fight devoid of meaning, if that even matters at all.

title.children: Gallen vs Williams is an unedifying prospect, but does that matter?

image.altText: A close up of a man with a white moustache and an yellow pagari

props.synopsis: Indian-born runner Fauja Singh was believed to be the oldest man to run a full marathon in 2011 at the age of 100 in Toronto.

title.children: Fauja Singh, world's 'oldest marathon runner', dies at 114 in hit-and-run

image.altText: West Indies batter Mikyle Louis completes his swing as the cricket ball hits his stumps.

props.synopsis: Former West Indies captain Carl Hooper calls for heads to roll and World Cup hero Carlos Brathwaite labels the team "abysmal" after the team's record 3-0 loss to Australia.

title.children: Abysmal, unfair, angry and upset: Aussies leave West Indies cricket in tatters

image.altText: Sketch of a man with short hair, a white shirt and a black tie.

props.synopsis: A supreme court jury has heard from a man who unwittingly helped dispose of Hannah McGuire's body after her ex-partner Lachlan Young planned to drug her, "put her in her car and roll her down a hill".

title.children: Man tells court Lachlan Young planned to 'roofie' Hannah McGuire

image.altText: a wall with unfinished skirting

props.synopsis: Here's what you should check before hiring a tradie — even when it's just for some minor renovations.

title.children: How to protect yourself against an unlicensed tradie

image.altText: Marla Maples.

props.synopsis: Marla Maples reveals the role she played in bringing the US president and Robert F Kennedy Jr into a powerful political alliance.

title.children: She was married to Trump, now she's helping rewrite America's health system

image.altText: A little corella looks down from a gum tree

props.synopsis: Hundreds of native corellas and pigeons are found dead in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Hundreds of birds die in Melbourne following suspected poisoning

image.altText: Illustration of a smashed piggy bank leaking coins, with a hammer in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Welfare for the wealthy. The battle over superannuation reform.

title.children: Who's a dole bludger now? Why our wealthy are fighting to retain a super rort

image.altText: A young man with curly hair and a vacant stare.

props.synopsis: Known for playing hard-partying keyboardist Viv Savage in Rob Reiner's 1984 cult classic This Is Spinal Tap, Kaff is being remembered by his bandmates as a "dear brother" with a "kind word and a quick wit".

title.children: Spinal Tap keyboardist David Kaff dies 'peacefully in his sleep'

image.altText: A young, dark-haired man with a whispy moustache.

props.synopsis: Zac Barnes was last seen running into bushland in 2016. His body has never been found, but a NSW coroner has recommended unsolved homicide investigators take over the case.

title.children: Missing teen died in 'suspicious circumstances', coroner finds

image.altText: A photo of a pangolin, with its tough scaly outer layer, arching its back at night in grass

props.synopsis: The ABC's beloved nature nerd, Dr Ann Jones, is on a mission to uncover the secret lives of some of the world's most elusive animals. Test yourself — or learn a thing or two — about these intriguing creatures.

title.children: Is a pangolin a mammal or reptile? Take our secretive animals quiz to find out
